oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sword and scabbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This model 1840 non-commissioned officer's sword is typically carried by sergeants, occasionally by corporals. It is of Union manufacture and features markings of "S F.S.S." on knuckle guard and "US 1863 F.S.S" on blade (likely an inspector's mark). The scabbard is leather and brass and is broken. The manufacturer of this item is Christopher Roby of Massachusetts as indicated on the blade.
